Checks if given username and password match correct credentials.

Parameters:

  • password (string) – The entered password.
Returns:

bool. True if username and password are correct, False otherwise.

landrecords.models.desc(column)¶

Produce a descending ORDER BY clause element.

e.g.:

from sqlalchemy import desc

stmt = select([users_table]).order_by(desc(users_table.c.name))

will produce SQL as:

SELECT id, name FROM user ORDER BY name DESC

The desc() function is a standalone version of the ColumnElement.desc() method available on all SQL expressions, e.g.:

stmt = select([users_table]).order_by(users_table.c.name.desc())
Parameters:column – A ColumnElement (e.g. scalar SQL expression) with which to apply the desc() operation.

See also

asc()

nullsfirst()

nullslast()

Select.order_by()

static figure_out_recorded_date()[source]¶

Treat Tuesday-Saturday like any other day. Don’t do anything on Sundays. Mondays tweet about entire previous week.

class landrecords.lib.libraries.Library[source]¶

The items.

streets = None¶

Not sure what to do for “St.”. This –> [‘ St’, ‘ St.’] would also pick up something such as 123 Straight Road. The same could conceivably happen with “Ave”. “Dr” needs to become “Drive”, but have the same problem
